getH(a_ops=None, b_ops=None, g=0)

Compute the Hamiltonian for the composite A + B system.

The interaction between A and B are

V_AB = sum_i g[i] * a_ops[i] * b_ops[i]

Parameters:

  • a_ops (list of arrays) – coupling operators for subsystem A

  • b_ops (list of arrays) – coupling operators for subsystem B

  • g (coupling constants) –

get_nonhermH(a_ops=None, b_ops=None, g=0)
The interaction between A and B are

V_AB = sum_i g[i] * a_ops[i] * b_ops[i]

Parameters:

  • a_ops (list of arrays) – coupling operators for subsystem A

  • b_ops (list of arrays) – coupling operators for subsystem B

  • g (coupling constants) –

pyqed.polariton.tdh module

Created on Wed Jun 7 14:47:19 2023

N molecules coupled with M cavity modes

@author: bing

pyqed.polariton.tdh.D(t, omega0=0.036749033500418936, gamma=0.0)

propagator for a single boson (photon) mode

if gamma < omega, .. math:

D^{-1}_0(t) = -

rac{1}{omega_0} (partial_t^2 + 2gammapartial_t + omega_0^2)

tTYPE

DESCRIPTION.

omegaTYPE, optional

DESCRIPTION. The default is 1.

gammaTYPE, optional

DESCRIPTION. The default is 0.

TYPE

DESCRIPTION.

class pyqed.polariton.tdh.TDH(mol, cav)

Bases: object

run(rho0, dt=0.01, nt=1, drive=None)
set_coupling(g)

The molecule-field interaction is given by .. math:

H_{CM} = g \mu (a + a^\dagger)

where g is the cooperative coupling strength.

Parameters:

g (TYPE) – DESCRIPTION.

Returns:

DESCRIPTION.

Return type:

TYPE
